questions.question: Which component in moulding sand provides the necessary binding strength in the wet state? (LO1)

explanations.a: Clay acts as a binding agent in moulding sand, increasing its cohesion and allowing it to retain shape in the wet state. The fine particles of clay coat the sand grains, enhancing the bonding strength and plasticity. This ensures that the mould holds its form before and during the casting process. Without clay, the sand would not have sufficient green strength to maintain structural integrity.

questions.question: What does the compression strength test of moulding sand determine? (LO2)

explanations.a: The compression strength test of moulding sand assesses its ability to withstand compressive forces in its green state (before drying or metal pouring). It helps in determining the bonding strength of sand due to the presence of clay and moisture. A higher green compression strength prevents the mould from breaking or deforming before the casting process.

questions.question: Why is the tensile strength test important for core sand? (LO1)

answers.a: To check how much the core can expand during metal solidification
answers.b: To ensure the core can withstand tensile stress due to shrinkage
answers.c: To determine the hardness of the sand
answers.d: To improve the surface finish of the casting

explanations.a: As molten metal cools, it shrinks and applies tensile forces on the core. The tensile strength test ensures that the core can resist these stresses without cracking or breaking. If the tensile strength is too low, the core may fracture, leading to casting defects such as unwanted cavities or distortions.
